member.name: IMFByteStreamHandler.BeginCreateObject
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request to create a media source from a byte stream.
member.param: Pointer to the byte stream's interface.
String that contains the original URL of the byte stream. This parameter can be NULL.
Bitwise OR of zero or more flags. See Source Resolver Flags.

Pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a property store. The byte-stream handler can use this property store to configure the object. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Configuring a Media Source.

Receives an IUnknown pointer or the value NULL. If the value is not NULL, you can cancel the asynchronous operation by passing this pointer to the method. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL.
Pointer to the interface of a callback object. The caller must implement this interface.

Pointer to the IUnknown interface of a state object, defined by the caller. This parameter can be NULL. You can use this object to hold state information. The object is returned to the caller when the callback is invoked.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Unable to parse the byte stream.

member.name: IMFByteStreamHandler.CancelObjectCreation
member.summary: Cancels the current request to create a media source.
member.param: Pointer to the IUnknown interface that was returned in the ppIUnknownCancelCookie parameter of the method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFByteStreamHandler.EndCreateObject
member.summary: Completes an asynchronous request to create a media source.
member.param: Pointer to the interface. Pass in the same pointer that your callback object received in the method.
Receives a member of the enumeration, specifying the type of object that was created.
Receives a pointer to the IUnknown interface of the media source. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Unable to parse the byte stream.

member.name: IMFByteStreamHandler.GetMaxNumberOfBytesRequiredForResolution
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum number of bytes needed to create the media source or determine that the byte stream handler cannot parse this stream.
member.param: Receives the maximum number of bytes that are required.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFByteStreamHandler
member.summary: Creates a media source from a byte stream.
